intro: Caralluma burchardii f. viridis, commonly known as the green-flowered caralluma, is a succulent plant native to arid regions of India. It belongs to the family Nyctaginaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, spiny stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant thrives in hot, dry climates and is adapted to store water in its thick leaves and stems. Its green flowers are typically borne in clusters and bloom during the warmer months. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
